{"fullName":"Robert Horvick","firstName":"Robert","longBio":"
    Robert spent nearly 10 years at Microsoft creating software that made it easier for everyone else to write software.  Most recently Robert worked on Team Foundation Server on the Administration and Version Control teams.  Currently Robert can be found working in the utilities sector on Smart Grid technologies.

Robert fled the Minnesota winters and currently lives near Raleigh, NC with his wife Susan and four children, Cecilia, Brian, Ben and Evelyn.  When not tackling technical challenges he enjoys playing the guitar and hanging out with his family.

Content.scott-allen:
{"fullName":"Scott Allen","firstName":"Scott","longBio":"

Scott has worked on everything from 8-bit embedded devices to large scale web sites during his 15+ years in commercial software development. Since 2001, Scott has focused on server-side and web technologies, like ASP.NET, ASP.NET AJAX, Windows Workflow, Silverlight, and LINQ. Scott is also a speaker at national conferences like VSLive!, as well as code camps and user groups near his hometown of Hagerstown, MD.

Scott has been recognized as a Microsoft MVP since 2005, and has written or co-authored several books on Microsoft technologies. Scott founded the site OdeToCode.com in 2004, and joined Pluralsight in 2007.

","optionalRssUrl":"http://odetocode.com/blogs/all","optionalTwitterUrl":"http://twitter.com/OdeToCode","optionalFacebookUrl":"","optionalLinkedInUrl":"http://www.linkedin.com/in/odetocode","courses":[{"title":"ASP.NET 5: First Look","level":"Intermediate","duration":"02:05:22","releaseDate":"2015-03-13T00:00:00+00:00","description":"ASP.NET 5 begins a radical departure from the origins of the ASP.NET framework over 15 years ago. With a new project structure, configuration system, and runtime, ASP.NET is now a lean framework for building web applications. In this course, we'll look at the new project structure and compilation model, the unification of ASP.NET MVC and the ASP.NET Web API, and the new Node.js tools that integrate with Visual Studio.","isNew":true,"name":"asp-dotnet-5-first-look","authoredBy":{"authorLinks":[{"text":"Scott Allen","url":"/author/scott-allen","title":"Scott Allen"}]},"authors":[{"handle":"scott-allen","firstName":"Scott","lastName":"Allen"}],"hasTranscript":false,"courseRating":{"currentUsersRating":0,"averageRating":4.8,"rating":4.8,"canRateThisCourse":false,"courseName":"asp-dotnet-5-first-look","numberOfRaters":615,"hasUserRatedCourse":false},"isRetired":false,"shortDescription":"An early look at the major changes in ASP.NET 5, which includes ASP.NET MVC 6.","sequence":0,"playerUrl":"Player?author=scott-allen&name=asp-dotnet-5-first-look-m1&clip=0&course=asp-dotnet-5-first-look"},{"title":"An AngularJS Playbook","level":"Intermediate","duration":"03:59:25","releaseDate":"2015-02-16T00:00:00+00:00","description":"The Playbook contains strategies and patterns for common scenarios in AngularJS applications. After an introductory module, the course looks at managing authorization tokens and a user model using services and HTTP interceptors. The third module provides strategies to implement consistent error handling and display of alert messages to the user. The fourth module will focus on UI topics, including working with an application that requires nested views and modal dialogs. The fifth module demonstrates custom directives you can use to help build and validate forms, including how to dynamically augment a view using the $compile service. The final module of the course will demonstrate techniques you can use to integrate third party libraries, including how to wrap jQuery plugins.","isNew":false,"name":"angularjs-playbook","authoredBy":{"authorLinks":[{"text":"Scott Allen","url":"/author/scott-allen","title":"Scott Allen"}]},"authors":[{"handle":"scott-allen","firstName":"Scott","lastName":"Allen"}],"hasTranscript":true,"courseRating":{"currentUsersRating":0,"averageRating":4.8,"rating":4.8,"canRateThisCourse":false,"courseName":"angularjs-playbook","numberOfRaters":310,"hasUserRatedCourse":false},"isRetired":false,"shortDescription":"The Playbook contains strategies and patterns for common scenarios in AngularJS applications. The scenarios include working with authorization tokens, nested routes, form validation, consistent error handling and diagnostics, as well as building custom directives to integrate with third party libraries.","sequence":0,"playerUrl":"Player?author=scott-allen&name=angularjs-playbook-m1&clip=0&course=angularjs-playbook"},{"title":"What's New in C# 6","level":"Intermediate","duration":"01:43:19","releaseDate":"2014-09-20T00:00:00+00:00","description":"C# 6 introduces new syntax features for primary constructors, exception filtering, static class usage, and more. We'll examine each of these language features in detail, and also look at the area where Microsoft worked the hardest: the compiler itself. Code-named Roslyn, the new compiler comes with an architecture that makes it easier to build tools and extensions for both the C# and Visual Basic languages.","isNew":false,"name":"csharp-6-whats-new","authoredBy":{"authorLinks":[{"text":"Scott Allen","url":"/author/scott-allen","title":"Scott Allen"}]},"authors":[{"handle":"scott-allen","firstName":"Scott","lastName":"Allen"}],"hasTranscript":true,"courseRating":{"currentUsersRating":0,"averageRating":4.5,"rating":4.5,"canRateThisCourse":false,"courseName":"csharp-6-whats-new","numberOfRaters":495,"hasUserRatedCourse":false},"isRetired":false,"shortDescription":"C# 6 introduces a number of new syntax features, as well as a new compiler technology. In this course, we will examine these features and also provide an introduction to the new compiler - code-named Roslyn.","sequence":0,"playerUrl":"Player?author=scott-allen&name=csharp-6-whats-new-m1&clip=0&course=csharp-6-whats-new"},{"title":"JavaScript Fundamentals for ES6","level":"Intermediate","duration":"04:50:54","releaseDate":"2014-09-17T00:00:00+00:00","description":"ECMAScript 6, or ES6, is the next version of JavaScript, and includes many enhancements and new features that make JavaScript coding easier and more maintainable. This course will teach you all of the features of this newest version, with an emphasis on the tools and technologies that will let you leverage these features today, even before they are fully implemented by browsers and Node.","isNew":false,"name":"javascript-fundamentals-es6","authoredBy":{"authorLinks":[{"text":"Allen","url":"/author/scott-allen","title":"Scott Allen"},{"text":"Eames","url":"/author/joe-eames","title":"Joe Eames"}]},"authors":[{"handle":"scott-allen","firstName":"Scott","lastName":"Allen"},{"handle":"joe-eames","firstName":"Joe","lastName":"Eames"}],"hasTranscript":false,"courseRating":{"currentUsersRating":0,"averageRating":4.8,"rating":4.8,"canRateThisCourse":false,"courseName":"javascript-fundamentals-es6","numberOfRaters":238,"hasUserRatedCourse":false},"isRetired":false,"shortDescription":"This course covers the features of ECMAScript 6, the next version of JavaScript, and how you can use them today.","sequence":0,"playerUrl":"Player?author=scott-allen&name=javascript-fundamentals-es6-m1-introduction&clip=0&course=javascript-fundamentals-es6"},{"title":"AngularJS: Get Started","level":"Beginner","duration":"02:56:45","releaseDate":"2014-06-06T00:00:00+00:00","description":"AngularJS is a complete JavaScript framework for creating dynamic and interactive applications in HTML. We will see how two-way data binding makes it easy to build pages and forms while maintaining simplicity in the JavaScript code, and come to understand the essential abstractions of AngularJS, including modules, controllers, directives, and services. By the end of the course, you'll be able to start building your own single page application using AngularJS.","isNew":false,"name":"angularjs-get-started","authoredBy":{"authorLinks":[{"text":"Scott Allen","url":"/author/scott-allen","title":"Scott Allen"}]},"authors":[{"handle":"scott-allen","firstName":"Scott","lastName":"Allen"}],"hasTranscript":true,"courseRating":{"currentUsersRating":0,"averageRating":4.8,"rating":4.8,"canRateThisCourse":false,"courseName":"angularjs-get-started","numberOfRaters":6617,"hasUserRatedCourse":false},"isRetired":false,"shortDescription":"This course demonstrates how to use the essential abstractions of AngularJS, including modules, controllers, directives, and services.","sequence":0,"playerUrl":"Player?author=scott-allen&name=angularjs-get-started-m1-introduction&clip=0&course=angularjs-get-started"},{"title":"C# Fundamentals with C# 5.0","level":"Beginner","duration":"06:14:31","releaseDate":"2014-02-28T08:48:04.024+00:00","description":"C# Fundamentals with C# 5.0 is designed to give you everything you need to become a productive C# developer on the .NET platform. In this series, we give talented developers a project to work on from scratch. We talk through it as they design and develop in real time for about 2 hours.
